newsitem.title: UK: Small fire disrupted UK Forties on Friday - BP.
newsitem.headline: Small fire disrupted UK Forties on Friday - BP.

text.p: Britain's million barrel a day Forties crude pipeline was closed briefly on Friday after a small fire, operator British Petroleum said on Tuesday.
The pipeline to BP's Kinneil gas separation plant on the east Scottish coast was closed at 2000 GMT on Friday after the discovery of a "very small" fire, a BP spokesman said.
The fire was quickly extinguished and the pipeline reopened at midnight on Friday, the spokesman said.
Industry sources said the pipeline remained at about 50 percent of capacity for a further 10 hours.
Traders on Tuesday were waiting to see whether the incident would have any impact on the April Forties programme.
Three mid-April Forties cargoes were cancelled last week as a result of lower than expected output from contributing fields.
Cancellation of April 14-16, April 17-19 and April 18-20 cargoes cut the April Forties programme to 41 cargoes, excluding crude piped direct to the Grangemouth refinery.
